Key Match Events: David Warner scored 163 off 124 balls, his highest score in ODIs.
Shaheen Shah Afridi took 5 wickets for 54 runs, his best bowling figures in ODIs.
Usama Mir took his first wicket in ODIs.
Adam Zampa took 4 wickets for 53 runs, his best bowling figures in ODIs.
Imam-ul-Haq and Abdullah Shafique put on a 134-run opening partnership, the highest for Pakistan in ODIs this year.
David Warner and Mitchell Marsh put on a 259-run opening partnership, the highest for Australia in ODIs this year.
Post-Match Reflections: David Warner was awarded the Player of the Match and the CRICINFO's MVP for his outstanding performance.
Pat Cummins praised the team's effort in chasing a big total and winning the match by 62 runs.
Shaheen Shah Afridi expressed disappointment with the team's performance and the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: David Warner's 163 off 124 balls was the highest score by an Australian in ODIs this year.
Shaheen Shah Afridi's 5 wickets for 54 runs was the best bowling figures by a Pakistani in ODIs this year.
The match was played at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.
The toss was won by Pakistan, who elected to field first.
The match was a 50-over match and was played under lights.
The match was part of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023-24.
Others: The match was played on October 20, 2023.
The match was the 18th match of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023-24.
The match was played between Australia and Pakistan.
The match was a day-night match and was played under lights.
